shapes

Class Circle

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.Shape
      • shapes.Circle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Color

    public final class Circle
extends Shape
    The Circle class definition. Implements method draw() which is abstract in class Shape. Sets and maintains a radius for the circle.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface shapes.Color

        BLUE, GREEN, LIGHT_BLUE, RED, YELLOW

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Circle()
      Constructor passes default values to Circle(int, int, int, String) constructor.
      Circle(int x, int y, int radius, java.lang.String color)
      Constructor sets radius of the circle and passes the point where it will draw to the Shape superclass constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String dimensions()
      Returns the radius of the circle.
      int getRadius()
      Returns the radius of the circle.
      void setRadius(int radius)
      Sets the radius of the circle which must be greater than zero (0) or equal to zero if null (default).

      • Methods inherited from class shapes.Shape

        getColor, getX, getY, setColor, setX, setY, toString

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

      • Circle

        public Circle(int x,
              int y,
              int radius,
              java.lang.String color)
        Constructor sets radius of the circle and passes the point where it will draw to the Shape superclass constructor.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate where the shape draws
        y - the y-coordinate where the shape draws
        radius - the radius of the circle
        color - a String that represents the color of the circle
